channel.title: Projects on Avinash Paul
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Avinash Paul

item.title: Project 3: Automatic Detection and Classication of Colonic Polyp using deep learning
item.description: Colorectal cancer (CRC) in its advanced stage is one of the leading causes of death worldwide. However, early detection of polyps which are the precursor to such cancer can lead to better prognosis and clinical management. This report proposes an automated diagnostic technique to detect, localize, and classify polyps in colonoscopy video frames. Manual detection and localization of polyps on hugely acquired colonic frames have many limitations. Our deep learning-based framework proposes an attention-based YOLOv4 detector for polyp detection and localization.

item.title: Project 2: A Data-efficient Classifier using GAN
item.description: Visual examination of polyps requires detail analysis by a skilled physician. Features like polyp color, shape and texture vary greatly in polyps. Thus, colonoscopy data is both difficult to acquire and annotating polyps is a cumbersome process. To address this issue of limited labeled data in endoscopic images, a semi-supervised classifier using generative adversarial network (GAN) is implemented here. Generative adversarial networks (GANs) are algorithmic architectures that use two neural networks, pitting one against the other (thus the “adversarial”) in order to generate new, synthetic instances of data that can pass for real data.

item.title: Project 1: Monocular depth Estimation
item.description: Getting a 3D view of the environment greatly helps in scene understanding and navigation. Estimating depth is something that comes to us naturally due to our stereo vision and our prior learning of the depth of the world around us. We use our inbuilt stereo vision for building a 3D view of the world around us. Finding depth is however, a difficult problem computationally. Finding depth from a single image or Monocular Depth Estimation (MDE) is an ill-posed problem given a number of scenes can have the same depth image.
